product.title: Going There

sub_title.text: Katie Couric (Author, Narrator), Little, Brown & Company (Publisher)

product.book_description: Heartbreaking, hilarious, and brutally honest, Going There is the deeply personal life story of a girl next door turned household name.  For more than 40 years, Katie Couric has been an iconic presence in the media world. In her brutally honest, hilarious, heartbreaking memoir, she reveals what was going on behind the scenes of her sometimes tumultuous personal and professional life - a story she’s never shared, until now. Of the medium she loves, the one that made her a household name, she says, “Television can put you in a box; the flat-screen can flatten. On TV, you are larger than life but smaller, too. It is not the whole story, and it is not the whole me. This book is." Beginning in early childhood, Couric was inspired by her journalist father to pursue the career he loved but couldn’t afford to stay in. Balancing her vivacious, outgoing personality with her desire to be taken seriously, she overcame every obstacle in her way: insecurity, an eating disorder, being typecast, sexism...challenges, and how she dealt with them, setting the tone for the rest of her career. Couric talks candidly about adjusting to sudden fame after her astonishing rise to co-anchor of the Today show, and guides us through the most momentous events and news stories of the era, to which she had a front-row seat: Rodney King, Anita Hill, Columbine, the death of Princess Diana, 9/11, the Iraq War.... In every instance, she relentlessly pursued the facts, ruffling more than a few feathers along the way. She also recalls in vivid and sometimes lurid detail the intense pressure on female anchors to snag the latest “get” - often sensational tabloid stories like Jon Benet Ramsey, Tonya Harding, and OJ Simpson. Couric’s position as one of the leading lights of her profession was shadowed by the shock and trauma of losing her husband to stage 4 colon cancer when he was just 42, leaving her a widow and single mom to two daughters, six and two. The death of her sister Emily, just three years later, brought yet more trauma - and an unwavering commitment to cancer awareness and research, one of her proudest accomplishments. Couric is unsparing in the details of her historic move to the anchor chair at the CBS Evening News - a world rife with sexism and misogyny. Her “welcome” was even more hostile at 60 Minutes, an unrepentant boys club that engaged in outright hazing of even the most established women. In the wake of the MeToo movement, Couric shares her clear-eyed reckoning with gender inequality and predatory behavior in the workplace, and downfall of Matt Lauer - a colleague she had trusted and respected for more than a decade. Couric also talks about the challenge of finding love again, with all the hilarity, false-starts, and drama that search entailed, before finding her midlife Mr. Right. Something she has never discussed publicly - why her second marriage almost didn’t happen.  If you thought you knew Katie Couric, think again. Going There is the fast-paced, emotional, riveting story of a thoroughly modern woman, whose journey took her from humble origins to superstardom. In this book, you will find a friend, a confidante, a role model, a survivor whose lessons about life will enrich your own. PLEASE NOTE: When you purchase this title, the accompanying PDF will be available in your Audible Library along with the audio.

top_reviews.title: America's Sweetheart is really a Mean Girl
top_reviews.body: Yes, Katie Couric has had an accomplished career, as entertainer and in tv journalism. This book makes clear she is far more an entertainer than she is a journalist. In this memoir, what she cares most about in life are the things of entertainment--money, celebrity, and standing out in a crowd, especially a crowd of VIPs. She's certainly a savvy self-promoter and competent as a tv newsperson (the Sarah Palin moment showed the rewards from persistent questioning that we always need more of.) But she doesn't come across as actually "smart", because--for all the opportunities she's had, she regards it all so trivially. Has she learned anything meaningful from her apparently rich experiences? It doesn't seem so from "Going There" which she says expresses her real self. She was, from the beginning, well suited to television: cute, and an extrovert with a great smile. Yes, she succeeded in a male-dominated field, but she seems to have played the game to do it. She has an off-putting double standard for men and women. She seems loath to criticize bad behavior in famous men, giving sort of a wink or a shrug to much of it in those she mentions (Sam Donaldson, Larry King, even Matt Lauer. Dinner with Jeffrey Epstein doesn't mean much other than to archly note how her boyfriend pointed out "how young" the women were. And how young were they? She doesn't say, or seem upset by being even tangentially part of his world.) Most people who knew her from the Today Show remember how mean she was to Ann Curry who, by comparison to Couric, always seemed genuine. I never understood it--Curry, professional, beautiful, reserved--seemed no threat to Katie's dominance on "Today". But in this memoir, you can see she's just kind of mean to other women. It's no wonder that one of the young women Lauer abused told Curry (who reported it), but didn't tell Couric. What woman would trust Katie with something like that? Here, she seems to criticize Lauer just as much as she has to, while often blaming his victims for not being as strong and assertive as Katie is. She publishes her emails to Lauer--and his to her. Also shares private emails to her from others, also apparently without their permission. Another Mean Girl move.) She's still mean to Curry here, repeating a "joke" Katie made at a Lauer roast even though she knew it hurt and humiliated Curry then. So let's do it again, for all time, in a book. (It was, btw, crude and unfunny even then.) She was hostile when Ashleigh Banfield got hired because Banfield was smart, pretty, and younger than Katie. She gets in digs at Deborah Norville, whom she permanently replaced when Norville went on maternity leave, for supposedly being unrelatable to viewers because of being so perfect. (It sounds like a compliment here. From Katie, it's not.) She snits about Martha Stewart not having a sense of humor until she went to prison. And on it goes. She doesn't mentor anyone because what if they're better than she is? Even at CBS News, making top dollar at $15 mill a year, she has to still be the mean girl, head of the pack. She even felt threatened when her husband, a lawyer, became a legal analyst on television. "He should stay in his lane," she thought. (Yes, she eventually tuned in to his illness and suggests she blames herself. But is it a pose or real remorse? With Katie, she discloses a lot of unflattering things, but her real feelings about them are hard to tell. And, yes, she's done good work to educate people about colorectal cancer and screenings. She does charitable cancer work. That's commendable, but also benefits her public image, which seems never far from her mind. Too harsh? Maybe. Maybe not. What really put me off wasn't all her digs at other famous women. It was the way she took out after her daughter's nanny. She used a different name, but the real name is out now as the woman felt she needed to defend herself. Couric wrote such insulting descriptions of her (a woman who was basically "co-parenting" with her for three years, but who Couric concludes had developed an "unhealthy" role in the household, "making" Couric abnormally dependent on her.) It's all kind of weird, unflattering to both, but particularly to the nanny who, in interviews, has said much of it wasn't true, and has supplied her own unflattering descriptions of Katie. Be that as it may, the nanny isn't a public figure with a best-selling book that millions will read and believe. It's a vintage mean girl move from Couric, but not surprising. As she often comes across here, Couric's self-centered, competitive, intellectually shallow, vain, petty and really -not- much of a "sweetheart".Read more

It's no wonder that one of the young women Lauer abused told Curry (who reported it), but didn't tell Couric. What woman would trust Katie with something like that? (It was, btw, crude and unfunny even then.) She was hostile when Ashleigh Banfield got hired because Banfield was smart, pretty, and younger than Katie. (Yes, she eventually tuned in to his illness and suggests she blames herself. But is it a pose or real remorse? With Katie, she discloses a lot of unflattering things, but her real feelings about them are hard to tell. And, yes, she's done good work to educate people about colorectal cancer and screenings. What really put me off wasn't all her digs at other famous women. It was the way she took out after her daughter's nanny. date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2021

top_reviews.title: Surprisingly unremarkable
top_reviews.body: I was surprised that this book was so...vapid. The writing is fine, but it seems to be filled with a lot of “humble brag” describing her heady years, followed by looooong and defensive explanations about why Couric’s career tanked after leaving The Today Show. She details, without insight or apology how incredibly competitive she is and didn’t lift a finger to help any other women struggling to navigate the sexist and cut throat world of on air television. Instead, she just comes off as a bit selfish and as misogynistic as the men she worked alongside. All in all, Going There reads like a superficial book report of a not-very-nice woman (long her reputation in the industry) more than any insightful or newsworthy reflection. Sorry, Katie, I really wanted to love it.Read more

top_reviews.title: Not enough depth to be interesting
top_reviews.body: I was hoping for a more in-depth memoir, expanding on interesting topics she covers only in a few pages each. I went through the book extremely quickly because there wasn't much that was thought-provoking to bite into. More than anything, Kouric comes across as sanctimonious and extremy calculating, a personality type that many likely would not trust personally. In discussing Matt Lauer, you get the creepy sense that she says what she needs to say today for the sake of her public image, casting Lauer in a negative light while she didn't appear too concerned about the "whispers" in the office while she was taking a huge paycheck from the show she shared with him. I wish I had not spent the money on this book.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2021

top_reviews.title: A Candid Reflection
top_reviews.body: As a pop culture junkie, my curiosity about this book was peaked by the buzz surrounding it, so I went into it wanting all the juicy details. Judging by the fact I devoured this over the past 36 hours, I’d say it met this expectation, but the book actually exceeded it in surprising ways. There are few things that peeve me more than a puff piece trying to pass as a memoir, but I’ve been fortunate to read plenty that are the complete opposite of that, particularly this one. She’s not just giving a retelling of her life, she’s reflecting on it. It takes a humble person to be able to say they handled things wrong, and there are several instances of this in the book. I feared that this would be a blood bath as it was portrayed by the media, but I really didn’t think she said anything really salacious. She was the harshest critic to herself, which is how a memoir should be. When did being honest about your perception of things turn into allegedly being intentionally mean or vile?? I can’t recommend this book enoughRead more

There are few things that peeve me more than a puff piece trying to pass as a memoir, but I’ve been fortunate to read plenty that are the complete opposite of that, particularly this one. She’s not just giving a retelling of her life, she’s reflecting on it. It takes a humble person to be able to say they handled things wrong, and there are several instances of this in the book.

I feared that this would be a blood bath as it was portrayed by the media, but I really didn’t think she said anything really salacious. She was the harshest critic to herself, which is how a memoir should be. When did being honest about your perception of things turn into allegedly being intentionally mean or vile??

I can’t recommend this book enough

top_reviews.title: Honest and brave
top_reviews.body: An incredibly heartfelt rendering of an ordinary woman who led an extraordinarily unexpected life. There was professional success, personal loss, mistakes made and lessons learned — all while raising two daughters and dealing with unfair double standards and harsh public criticism from sometimes all corners. I loved this book — it made me laugh, it made me cry, and it made me feel grateful for our capacity to grow and change.Read more

top_reviews.title: Very interesting
top_reviews.body: Even though I found this book just a little bit too long, I did enjoy it. I find Katie to be a very interesting and relevant person in news, who has done a great deal to pave the way for female journalists after her. Her personal life was quite entertaining and gave great insight into why she is who she is. Her honesty about any perceived faults was welcome and well expressed. I was greatly moved by the tragedy in her life, having lost her husband, sister, sister-in-law and her parents. While losing parents is part of the natural and expected order of things, losing the rest of them certainly isn't. The pictures were a wonderful bonus.Read more

product.title: Not All Diamonds and Rosé: The Inside Story of The Real Housewives from the People Who Lived It

sub_title.text: Dave Quinn (Author), Amy Phillips (Narrator), Macmillan Audio (Publisher) & 0 more

product.book_description: The audiobook is read by Amy Phillips, comedian, Real Housewives superfan, and Bravolebrity impressionist. Amy is also the host of the Radio Andy SiriusXM show Reality Checked.  The instant number one New York Times best seller!  “I like to think of NOT ALL DIAMONDS AND ROSÉ as the ultimate reunion. I know readers will be surprised, entertained, and even shocked at what’s in store." (Andy Cohen) Dave Quinn's Not All Diamonds and Rosé is the definitive oral history of the hit television franchise The Real Housewives, from its unlikely start in the gated communities of Orange County to the pop culture behemoth it has become - spanning nine cities, hundreds of cast members, and millions of fans. What is it really like to be a housewife? We all want to know, but only the women we love to watch and the people who make the show have the whole story. Well, listen in close, because they’re about to tell all. Nearly all the wives, producers, and network executives, as well as Andy Cohen himself, are on the record, unfiltered and unvarnished about what it really takes to have a tagline. This is your VIP pass to the lives behind the glam squads, testimonials, and tabloid feuds. Life’s not all diamonds and rosé, but the truth is so much better, isn’t it? PLEASE NOTE: When you purchase this title, the accompanying PDF will be available in your Audible Library along with the audio.

top_reviews.title: Trash
top_reviews.body: I thought this would be am inside scoop as told by a director in a narrative format, with some interesting facts from behind the scenes that we didn't already know. Instead it's literally just transcripts of dialogue between housewives reminiscing about their very first season or episode and recounting drama from several seasons ago. Waste of time and overpriced for something that reads like a group WhatsApp conversation.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 21, 2021

top_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
top_reviews.body: So, even though the shouting bothers me, I do like this show. I have watched ROHBH and ROHNYC since the beginning so that is some time commitment right there. I ignored the review of this book by another customer because of optimism. I had hoped it would be insightful or interesting. It is not. Save your money. It is a load of quotes strung together around some of the more famous moments. It really could have been transcribed from their little scenes to camera, that they shot at the time. If you’ve seen the show - there is no need to read this book. If you’ve not seen the show - why on earth would you read this book?! A better look at behind the scenes reality tv is the TV show UNREAL. Which you can see on Amazon. That’s really good if you like this sort of thing.Read more

product.description:
Designed to provide excellent all-around performance, graphics, and productivity in a flexible device, the Lenovo Flex 5 14 14-inch laptop is built to be what you need it to be. Proudly powered by AMD Ryzen™ 5000 Series mobile processors with integrated AMD Radeon™ Graphics, the Flex 5 14 has a 360⁰ hinge and touchscreen display, making it easy to watch, work, and create to your heart's content. Reduce the clutter with four-sided narrow bezels for more viewing area on the FHD IPS panel. Plus, with a 12-hour battery* with Quick Charge, this slim and lightweight laptop is your ideal travel companion, whether you're working at the coffee shop or flying across the country.

The Flex 5 14 is a 2-in-1 laptop that's made to be used the way you want. Flip the hinge and use the touchscreen in "tablet" mode to take notes, draw, or interact with the computer in intuitive ways. Fold it into the familiar "laptop" mode for everyday computing and productivity tasks. Put your convertible laptop in "tent" mode to share photos, videos, or documents so everyone can see your full HD screen. Or flip it into "stand" mode to watch your favorite streaming movies and shows. This easy-to-use laptop also comes with Windows 11 Home, a backlit keyboard, a webcam privacy shutter, and a fingerprint reader.

* All battery life claims are approximate and based on results using the MobileMark® 2014 battery life benchmark test. Actual battery life will vary and depends on many factors such as product configuration and usage, software use, wireless functionality, power management settings, and screen brightness. The maximum capacity of the battery will decrease with time and use.

top_reviews.title: A powerful and versatile tablet/laptop
top_reviews.body: Coming from a traditional laptop, this is an amazing option if you want a truly versatile and convenient computer. I wouldn't expect to play games at the highest settings but for it's price point it makes sense. I didn't think I'd be using the touchscreen as much as I thought. It is super smooth like you'd expect a high end tablet. The keyboard is easy to get used to. I'm used to a full size keyboard but I don't really miss it so that's a great sign. It's really easy to switch between tent mode, tablet mode, or laptop mode. 2 USB ports is kind of limiting. The pen works really well. The plastic piece that attaches to the USB port is really cheap feeling and doesn't hold the pen upright (even though there's a hole on top as if it's supposed to) but it's not a big deal. Out of the box it doesn't seem to be as smooth as the lens like from the Samsung tab S7 plus, but I'm sure it just takes some messing with the settings. The battery life is really good. I'd say it's on par with laptops. You could get by almost the whole day without charging and if you need to, it charges pretty quickly. Overall I'm very happy with this laptop and I'm excited to work on creative projects with it!Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Coming from a traditional laptop, this is an amazing option if you want a truly versatile and convenient computer. I wouldn't expect to play games at the highest settings but for it's price point it makes sense.

I didn't think I'd be using the touchscreen as much as I thought. It is super smooth like you'd expect a high end tablet.

The keyboard is easy to get used to. I'm used to a full size keyboard but I don't really miss it so that's a great sign. It's really easy to switch between tent mode, tablet mode, or laptop mode. 2 USB ports is kind of limiting.

The pen works really well. The plastic piece that attaches to the USB port is really cheap feeling and doesn't hold the pen upright (even though there's a hole on top as if it's supposed to) but it's not a big deal. Out of the box it doesn't seem to be as smooth as the lens like from the Samsung tab S7 plus, but I'm sure it just takes some messing with the settings.

The battery life is really good. I'd say it's on par with laptops. You could get by almost the whole day without charging and if you need to, it charges pretty quickly.

Overall I'm very happy with this laptop and I'm excited to work on creative projects with it!
Read more

top_reviews.title: I love this computer but....
top_reviews.body: I like the actual computer but the Lenovo company is a joke. I ordered one computer directly from the Lenovo company. It took 3 weeks to get here and it was defective. Without going into full detail, I had to contact the company to try and fix the computer. Firstly, good luck getting through to anyone. And if you do succeed in getting through, you will be transferred 100 times, because each person you speak with says that it is not their department. Then, if you are lucky enough to get to the correct department you probably will be disconnected and have to start the process all over again. Additionally, you will most likely not understand a word they are saying. Without going over the full details of the three days it took me to finally speak with someone, their advice was to send the computer back, and they would send me another one, which would be here in about 4 weeks. So, I requested a refund which took 6-8 weeks to fully process. In the meantime I needed a computer immediately so I decided to try again with the same exact computer. This time I bought the computer through Amazon and it was delivered in 48 hours. I subsequently wrote a detailed letter to the Lenovo company and emailed it to every email address that i could find, to document my experience. I did not hear back from anyone. I am sure at least one email got through to someone, somewhere. Anyway, I really like the computer that I got from Amazon. My only complaint, which is probably my fault, is that the computer screen is a bit too small and is hard to see at times.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:

In the meantime I needed a computer immediately so I decided to try again with the same exact computer. This time I bought the computer through Amazon and it was delivered in 48 hours. I am sure at least one email got through to someone, somewhere.

Anyway, I really like the computer that I got from Amazon. My only complaint, which is probably my fault, is that the computer screen is a bit too small and is hard to see at times.

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022

top_reviews.title: Excelente
top_reviews.body: Me ha gustado bastante esta pc, llevo poco con ella pero se siente de buena calidad. Ofrece bastante para su precio; la pantalla es adecuada, el Ryzen 5500u sirve incluso para jugar a fortnite (modo rendimiento a mas de 60 fps) Obviamente se calienta cuando se somete a altas cargas de trabajo como el gaming, ademas de que las entradas y salidas de aire no son muy optimas. De cualquier modo, recomendaría un teclado externo y mouse para una mejor experiencia al jugar, y audífonos en el modo tableta a que las bocinas quedan del lado opuesto a la pantalla al hacer flip. El hecho de que incluya el lápiz es un plus, aunque creo que podría ser mejor, tiene un accesorio para anclarlo a una entrada usb, pero es un poco estorbo, así que hay que tener cuidado de no perder ese lápiz. Una cosa que no me ha gustado es la disposición del botón de encendido/apagado. Está en el lateral derecho y en ocaciónes lo presiono sin querer al momento de moverla o voltearla a modo tableta; no es nada grave pero estaría mejor integrado junto al teclado, o incluso en el sensor de huella. Otro punto negativo no es realmente del hardware, sino del Windows 11 que viene preinstalado, y es que tiene aun varios bugs gráficos y demás. Imagino que se corregirán con el tiempo. Por ultimo, el especio según que necesites descargar puede ser insuficiente, afortunadamente puede cambiarse por un ssd m.2 de mayor capacidad, pero es algo a considerar. En general estoy contento con ella, me parece una buena compra incluso con el impuesto de importación. Iré actualizando según se necesite.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Me ha gustado bastante esta pc, llevo poco con ella pero se siente de buena calidad. Ofrece bastante para su precio; la pantalla es adecuada, el Ryzen 5500u sirve incluso para jugar a fortnite (modo rendimiento a mas de 60 fps)
Obviamente se calienta cuando se somete a altas cargas de trabajo como el gaming, ademas de que las entradas y salidas de aire no son muy optimas.
De cualquier modo, recomendaría un teclado externo y mouse para una mejor experiencia al jugar, y audífonos en el modo tableta a que las bocinas quedan del lado opuesto a la pantalla al hacer flip.

El hecho de que incluya el lápiz es un plus, aunque creo que podría ser mejor, tiene un accesorio para anclarlo a una entrada usb, pero es un poco estorbo, así que hay que tener cuidado de no perder ese lápiz.

Una cosa que no me ha gustado es la disposición del botón de encendido/apagado. Está en el lateral derecho y en ocaciónes lo presiono sin querer al momento de moverla o voltearla a modo tableta; no es nada grave pero estaría mejor integrado junto al teclado, o incluso en el sensor de huella.

Otro punto negativo no es realmente del hardware, sino del Windows 11 que viene preinstalado, y es que tiene aun varios bugs gráficos y demás. Imagino que se corregirán con el tiempo.

Por ultimo, el especio según que necesites descargar puede ser insuficiente, afortunadamente puede cambiarse por un ssd m.2 de mayor capacidad, pero es algo a considerar.

En general estoy contento con ella, me parece una buena compra incluso con el impuesto de importación.
Iré actualizando según se necesite.

top_reviews.title: Excellente Laptop 2 en 1, para arte, CAD y juegos ligeros.
top_reviews.body: El Ryzen 5500u es lo suficientemente rapido para correr juegos modernos de 30 a 60fps a 1280x720p en graficos bajos, y por consecuencia corre software profesional como Solidworks, Autocad y Fusion360 sin problemas. Su tamaño es ideal, el stylus funciona de forma perfecta, y la bateria llegar a durar 11 horas de uso ligero, unas 8 viendo videos y unas 3 en programas que requieren potencia. A su vez, el teclado se siente bien y es retroiluminado, y el detector de huellas hace que iniciar sesion sea rapido y facil. Los unicos detalles que no me gustan es que esta algo pesada y la pantalla no llega a ser tan brillante como me gustaria.Read more

How to switch s mode to windows 10

On your PC running Windows 10 in S mode, open Settings > Update & Security > Activation.

In the Switch to Windows 10 Home or Switch to Windows 10 Pro section, select Go to the Store. (If you also see an "Upgrade your edition of Windows" section, be careful not to click the "Go to the Store" link that appears there.)

On the Switch out of S mode (or similar) page that appears in the Microsoft Store, select the Get button. After you see a confirmation message on the page, you'll be able to install apps from outside of the Microsoft Store.

Windows 10 in S mode is designed for security and performance, exclusively running apps from the Microsoft Store. If you want to install an app that isn't available in the Microsoft Store, you'll need to switch out of S mode. Switching out of S mode is one-way. If you make the switch, you won't be able to go back to Windows 10 in S mode. There's no charge to switch out of S mode.

top_reviews.body: It was great and perfect. For seven days. Today it quit working for no apparent reason. Just shut off right in the middle of one of my son's lessons. top_reviews.title: I really wanted this to be good but...
top_reviews.body: The media could not be loaded. I am adding a short video that I HIGHLY encourage you watch before buying! On paper this seems like a really good value. Specs wise it is. It feels really well made from the aluminum chassis to the great keyboard and trackpad. The color accuracy and viewing angles are also pretty good surprisingly for the price.. However,, The screen on mine has quite literally the worst motion blur I have ever seen on an IPS laptop panel. With even the slightest movement dragging or scrolling through windows and the text becomes almost completely unreadable. So bad that I was compelled to attach a short video to this review. I made sure it was set to 60hz and it is. Its only been a few hours since I got it so I will do all the windows updates and see if there is any firmware available for the chip but I'm not going to hold my breath. I have worked with enough computers and monitors to know that is not much you can do with the quality of a laptop panel. Given how bad mine is and not seeing any other reviewers mention the problem makes me hope its only a defect. But if this is the actual quality of the panel its getting sent back. I don't care how affordable it is. If you cannot simply scroll down a page and read text comfortably its worthless.Read more

With even the slightest movement dragging or scrolling through windows and the text becomes almost completely unreadable. So bad that I was compelled to attach a short video to this review. I made sure it was set to 60hz and it is. Its only been a few hours since I got it so I will do all the windows updates and see if there is any firmware available for the chip but I'm not going to hold my breath. I have worked with enough computers and monitors to know that is not much you can do with the quality of a laptop panel. Given how bad mine is and not seeing any other reviewers mention the problem makes me hope its only a defect. But if this is the actual quality of the panel its getting sent back. I don't care how affordable it is. If you cannot simply scroll down a page and read text comfortably its worthless.
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2021

top_reviews.title: Good Laptop, Odd Camera location.
top_reviews.body: The value for this Laptop is great. The material seems solid while remaining light weight. I have had it for 5 days, and had no issues. It is easy to set up and get to work. The only issue is the location of the web camera at the bottom of the screen rather than to top is odd. It is looking up your nose. Not a pleasant angle for web camera conversations. If you are planning on using this for that, you will need to use a different camera or put the laptop on some kind of angled stand to avoid this. It still might not be what you are looking for. I was aware of this from other reviews, and as I am not planning on using this laptop for that it is not an issue for me.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2021

top_reviews.title: Value for money
top_reviews.body: I am not a computer buff, just an old guy whose old laptop died, & was in need of a replacement. Not too expensive !! I read various reviews, not one bad one. I read one w review by some geek reviewer, whose 1st. statement was, he was not expecting much due to the low price. But then as he went through the review, he was surprised at how good everything was. In fact, I don't recall him having one bad word to say about the AllDoCube GTBook. Anyway, I was sold on it and purchased one. I just needed to replace my 17" laptop & 14" was as small as I wanted to go. I have an 11" tablet -- very nice but too too small! With this machine I think I have found what I need -- easy to see, to read, the keyboard is way better than the old laptop, suits my hand size & it lights up, I am not a touch typist, strictly two fingers! At the end of the day I have just what I want, within my buget. I am well pleased.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021

top_reviews.title: Nice laptop but with a serious issue - Update
top_reviews.body: Got this laptop as a replacement for a chromebook. Never really liked the chromebook so I thought I'd try a MS book instead. All I use it for is streaming and some news. This G7 has a nice heft to it and feels solid. It has a quality feel. I like the 12g ram and the 1080p display. I like the backlit keyboard and the screen size. The keyboard has a nice tactile feel to it. The processor is a little stronger than others which I felt was an issue with the chromebook so I upped my purchase to the G7 to get the 5100. The power cord is short but I used the C connector since that cord is a lot longer and it seemed to work. The big downfall is the battery life. Last night I charged it to 100% and listened to a radio stream for about 20 minutes....no video. Shut it down...which logs off the computer...and went to sleep. Woke up and started browsing. I've been on for about 2-2.5 hours and done nothing but read static text sites...news sites...yahoo, etc and the battery is below 60%. With less than 3 hours viewing on a full charge and absolutely no video, the battery sits at 59%. I have screen brightness set to less than half and it's running on battery saver full time. I must have gotten a dud battery because 10000 mh should last longer. Streaming video makes it drop like a rock. 20 minutes of streaming took 10% of the battery. It's a shame it's going back because it's a nice laptop otherwise. I liked most everything about the GT except the battery. Sent it back an got another...same problem. One issue is that their website says the GT has a 5000 mah battery and the doc that came with the computer says 5000 mah but the info on the Amazon site says 10000. With that said, everything else stacks up. I like all the features about the laptop so I just adjusted and kept the second. Disabling bluetooth and notifications along with microsoft 'lock manager' (???) gives me a decent run on a charge plus I didn't care about those other features anyway. The seller responded quickly and the return process was a breeze.Read more

top_reviews.body: Got this laptop as a replacement for a chromebook. Never really liked the chromebook so I thought I'd try a MS book instead. All I use it for is streaming and some news. This G7 has a nice heft to it and feels solid. It has a quality feel. I like the 12g ram and the 1080p display. I like the backlit keyboard and the screen size. The keyboard has a nice tactile feel to it. The processor is a little stronger than others which I felt was an issue with the chromebook so I upped my purchase to the G7 to get the 5100. The power cord is short but I used the C connector since that cord is a lot longer and it seemed to work. The big downfall is the battery life. Last night I charged it to 100% and listened to a radio stream for about 20 minutes....no video. Shut it down...which logs off the computer...and went to sleep. Woke up and started browsing. I've been on for about 2-2.5 hours and done nothing but read static text sites...news sites...yahoo, etc and the battery is below 60%. With less than 3 hours viewing on a full charge and absolutely no video, the battery sits at 59%. I have screen brightness set to less than half and it's running on battery saver full time. I must have gotten a dud battery because 10000 mh should last longer. Streaming video makes it drop like a rock. 20 minutes of streaming took 10% of the battery. It's a shame it's going back because it's a nice laptop otherwise. I liked most everything about the GT except the battery. Sent it back an got another...same problem. One issue is that their website says the GT has a 5000 mah battery and the doc that came with the computer says 5000 mah but the info on the Amazon site says 10000. With that said, everything else stacks up. I like all the features about the laptop so I just adjusted and kept the second. Disabling bluetooth and notifications along with microsoft 'lock manager' (???) gives me a decent run on a charge plus I didn't care about those other features anyway. The seller responded quickly and the return process was a breeze.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2021

top_reviews.title: Perfect bag for gym and working out
top_reviews.body: I recently started working out at my school and wanted a bigger bag that I could dedicate to actual gym clothes/equipment. I chose a medium, as I expected the small would not be able to fit everything that I needed. When I first opened the packaging that contained the bag, I was pleasantly surprised as to how big a medium duffel bag actually is. There is plenty of room for clothes, extra shoes, bottles, balls, etc. in this bag. The bag for me is actually too big, but it is fine for everything I need, so it is not a complaint. In fact, I am still able to fit this bag into a small locker, as it can be smashed down to fit in small compartments. I recommend getting this size because it can fit everything I need comfortably and more if needed. I have no problem throwing it in the back seat on the ground of my car, so transporting it is no problem at all. For functionality, it works very well, as not only does the main compartment have all the space needed, the extra compartments are nice if you are designating them for clothes, keys, or shoes. Although not a feature of the bag, I will give credit to the durability of the bag. The material is premium and has not shown any fading of any sort. I do think the bag will last a long time and will be my to-go gym bag. Overall, I highly recommend the bag. Although a bit pricey, I think the bag is worth it, considering the long-term value. If you are looking for a spacious bag, I think this bag is perfect. However, if you are only transporting clothes, I think a smaller bag may suit the consumer better, just because it is a lot of excess space.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021

top_reviews.title: This medium-sized bag is actually quite large.
top_reviews.body: I purchased this item to use as my gym bag. I enjoy this bag, but it is quite large for a medium and I always have quite a bit of extra room. This bag would be great for traveling as a carry on- with one exception. Although the arm strap is well-padded, it still puts a strain on the shoulder; I have found that putting the strap over my head alleviates this to a degree, but if someone packed this bag full, it could be a heavy carry though an airport, etc.. Having said that, the bag is exceptionally durable and water resistant. I had something spill in the bag (which was deposited there by a child) and it was held in the bag entirely and can't even be seen from the outside of the bag. I would buy this bag again.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2021

top_reviews.title: Great bag. Great price.
top_reviews.body: I was on a trip and unexpectedly ended up with more items than would fit in my luggage. I needed a sturdy bag and fast. I wanted something that would serve more purposes than just another suitcase. Meet the adidas duffel bag. This bag was sturdy and the long carry handle was easy to remove for airplane check-in and easy to re-attach for carrying. There are big side pockets that fit a pair of doc marten boots on one side and slippers and a belt on the other with plenty of space in the main compartment. The bag also folds up nicely for storing. Came with a couple of elastic bands to hold it together in a small square the size of the ends and about 3 inches thick. Great quality and value for the price.Read more

top_reviews.title: The BEST Gym Duffle
top_reviews.body: Let me start off by saying, I’m an equestrian. I go to and from a dusty, dirty barn to the gym or to a horse show everyday. I was skeptical of getting white but it matched my general aesthetic and based off of other reviews, I figured it might get a bit dirty but a quick wash would be fine. This duffle is full out hydrophobic and I accidentally dropped it in the dust floor part of the barn, brushed it off and it looks brand new!! The shoe compartment is a great size and there’s plenty of storage for wet items, a mesh sleeve for gym towels and adjustable straps! It also fits in the tiniest of gym lockers so I’m giving this 5/5!Read more
top_reviews.body_html:

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021

top_reviews.title: Pretty decent bag
top_reviews.body: I bought this to use for two young girls playing soccer as I knew it'd fit their two balls, shoes, etc. I am not a huge fan of the completely-open zip top. Once you unzip, things start to fall out easily and there aren't two zippers to "control" how much is open. I also would like to see a couple more organizing pockets inside and outside the bag. The shoe area is nice - we used this but still put the shoes in a disposable shopping bag as they were often muddy/dirty to spare the inside of the bag. (OK, to spare me from having to clean the inside of the bag!) It is nice and lightweight, a nice color (we have black) and spots are wiped off easily. It's a decent bag and we'll keep it until we need to get them each a separate bag but I wouldn't buy this again for this purpose. (And that wide-open top would prevent me from buying it for almost any purpose, though some may find that its best quality.)Read more

top_reviews.title: My money's worth and more
top_reviews.body: I used this bag as my only travel piece shortly after receiving it. It was obvious that it would hold up to anything I might include, and I tend to bring along just about anything. It is sturdy, the zippers operate smoothly, and there was ample space for three nights' stay. I do not know yet about water resistance, though the feel seems right for that. In the event that I cannot rate a specific category, I will never rate lower than the average of all others ; in this case keeping the well-deserved "5" as the overall rating.Read more

I do not know yet about water resistance, though the feel seems right for that. In the event that I cannot rate a specific category, I will never rate lower than the average of all others ; in this case keeping the well-deserved "5" as the overall rating.

product.description:
Basic Information 
Size: 24”*10”*13” 
Weight: 2.6lbs 
Capacity: 68.6L 
Material: 600 denier polyester lined with PVC 


 

Description 
The military duffel bag is perfect for traveling,over night camping,etc. The duffel bag have water resistant you can not worry about rain, it is also durable and tear resistant. 
The military duffel bag has 4 compartments. The smaller side compartment you can put a toolbox or something you want in it.The other side compartment you can put a pair of shoes or dirty clothes.The main compartment you can put some clothes, towel, rope and so on. The front compartment has a mesh bag can be placed phone, key, etc. 
The shoulder strap padding a removable foam to reduce the shoulder's force and the strap can be adjusted according to what you want.The handle was reinforced, it is tear resistant and wear resistant. 


 

Features 
Reinforced handle and adjusted shoulder strap 
The side compartment can load dirty clothes 
Padding a foam in shoulder straps 
Detachable and adjustable shoulder straps 
Water resistant and tear resistant

product.title: Blingbling Petsfun Electric Wireless Dog Fence System, Pet Containment System with Waterproof and Rechargeable Training Collar Receiver for 2 Dogs Pets Container Boundary White
product.title_excluding_variant_name: Blingbling Petsfun Electric Wireless Dog Fence System, Pet Containment System with Waterproof and Rechargeable Training Collar Receiver for 2 Dogs Pets Container Boundary
product.description:
Features:

1. Exclusive use of 433 Hz technology, provides a more stable and accurate signal transmission 
2. Equipped with reflective strips to improve safety at night
3. Control over three dogs at the same time and use directly without Matching code
4. Low Shock electricity, no harmful te dogs 
5. Additional 20Pcs training flags and clicker help dogs adapt to the signal immediately

Notice: 

1. Set up collar receiver 
Before first using our Rechargeable and Waterproof Collar Receiver please make sure charging it at least 4 hours. Turning on the power button on the receiver and the red LED light will turn on. When the indicator light turns flashing red it means battery is running down and needs to be recharged. 
2. Correction system 
1. Pre-correction warning tone: when the dog reaches the edge of the signal field it will hear a warning tone that lasts about two seconds. If the dog does not return to the safe area it will receive a continuous correction by warning tone static shock until it returns to the safe area. 
2. Run-through prevention: the receiver automatically increases the correction as the dog enters the signal field. The dog cannot “run through” the signal field without receiving strong correction.

【⭐RECHARGEABLE COLLARS AND FOR ALL DOG SIZES】 The Rechargeable Receiver Collar Built With High Capacity Durable Battery, No More Extra Battery Expenses. And The Collars Suitable for Extra-large, Large, Medium and Small Breed Dog. It’s Suitable for the Dog Neck from 7 to 26.5inches.

top_reviews.title: Fabulous Wireless Dog Fence System
top_reviews.body: I wish I'd found this a year ago! What a great wireless dog fence system. Easy to set up and works as described. I was worrying because we moved to a new house and there is no fence around, and I have a high-energy boxer mix (70 lbs). I read the reviews and all the materials before installing or training. this fence took me a few hours to set up, I set the receiver and measured the boundary holding a collar and listening for the beeps. It took only once or twice of going beyond the boundary for them to figure it out. We are on our third day of training, and I take them outside 3-4 times a day and walk the boundary and praise them. They are a little freaked out after being shocked a couple of times, but I've been feeding them cheese while we are outside and squeaking a toy, and they seem happy and stick close to me. I hope with positive reinforcement they will start relaxing a bit more when in the yard. It's been wonderful not having to mess with leashes when I take them out to do their business. My big dog barked at a neighbor this morning and started running towards him, but I said "no" loudly and he stopped short of the flags without getting shocked. I'm so happy with this wireless dog fence system.Read more

top_reviews.title: First Wireless dog fence system
top_reviews.body: This is my first time bought a wireless dog fence system. We used to have a In-ground electronic dog fence system which has a much cheaper price than this wireless one. It was working well, but my baby is too smart to contain by a piece of Boundary wire. She learned that when she close to the boundary wire she will be pulished but crossing it by a fast speed will be fine from few shocks. Therefore, wired dog fence system became useless to her. But this wireless one is totally effective, she will be pulished when she closes to the boundary and crosses over. Now, she has no way to run away. I know having my baby to be shocked is not a gentle thing, but having my baby running away and having incident is a unacceptable thing.Read more

brand_story.title: Vertical Wireless Fence Dog Containment System
brand_story.description: The product adopts the latest technology, the signal transmission distance is long and the penetration ability is strong, the signal will not be blocked by walls or other objects when the host is placed anywhere in the home. Reasonable design makes the receiver vibrate first and then electrostatic shock. After repeated use, the dog will clearly realize that it must return to the safe area when the receiver vibrates. If the dog does not go back, the receiver will keep reminding until the dog returns to the safe area. A host can be used with multiple receivers and can control multiple dogs at the same time. The receiver is suitable for dogs of all sizes: the receiver is equipped with conductive posts of different lengths, which can be freely selected according to the size of the dog and the length of the hair.

feature_bullets: The product has passed Fcc certification. Using the latest technology, and the receiver will not electric shock the dog after the host is turned off.

With strong signal penetration capability, the host can be placed anywhere in the home. The signal is transmitted around the transmitter, and the dog can receive the signal from any position. The house is too big, you can use two transmitters at the same time, put them in different corners, so that the signal transmission distance is increased.
The signal transmission distance is long. the signal transmission distance can reach 1,000 feet.

Vibration reminder first, then static electric shock, that the dog will not received static electric shock as soon as it leaves the safe area. After a few times of use, the dog will clearly realize that it must return to the safe area when the receiver vibrates.

After the receiver vibrates and the static electric shock cycle works twice, if the dog does not return to the safe area, the receiver will keep sounding reminders until the dog returns to the safe area.

Using the latest technology, and the receiver will not electric shock the dog after the host is turned off.

product.description:
Electric Dog Fence with 984 Feet Wire and Two Waterproof Collar, Above ground Underground Dog Fence Containment System, Suitable for Small, Medium, Large Dogs


The electric dog fence not only prevents your dog running out from the yard but also trains it in a customized way.

 Allow your dog to get used to the collar before you begin training.You want your dog to accept the collar as part of a routine,not to associate the collar with correction. 

 While playing or training,the fence system helps your dog to recognize its boundaries so it never crosses the marked area.

Package Includes

1 x Indoor wall-mounted transmitter

 1 x Power plug

 1 x Adjustable receiver collar

 1 x 6 Volt battery for collar

 1 x boundary wire of 300 meters

 4 x Extra metal contact points

 20 x Training flags

 1 x Test bulb

 4 x screws

 1 x User Manual

 CAUTION

 * *Do not leave the collar on your dog for more than 12 hours per day.
 *  *Do not test the containment system with the collar receiver on the dog.
 *  *A low battery may cause intermittent operation.DO NOT USE if you suspect a low battery.
 *  *Never perform set-up procedures when the collar is on your dog.
 *  *Keep out of the reach of children.
 *  *Read all instructions before using this product.
feature_bullets: Electronic Dog Fencing System: This kit includes a wall-mounted transmitter that,984 feet of wire can cover more than 1.2 acres in square and 1.77 acres in circle land. The wireless electric fence gives your dogs a secure yard to play.

Tone and Shock Stimulus:This dog fence prevents your dog from running out of the yard. When your dog move closer to the boundary,the warning tone will be issued first,then a shock stimulus after 4-10 seconds warning your dog not running out of the boundary.

top_reviews.title: Good for slower, older dog.
top_reviews.body: I have a Brittany Spaniel, and she has one speed - Light speed only! if she is too close to the boundry when she takes off, it immediately starts to beep at her and continues until she completly stops. This is not effective, I want her to run. We enclosed 4 acres for that reason (bought additional line). I have tried turning down the sensitivity, but it does the same thing. So she can stay in the middle of the perimeter and run as fast as she wants, but is afraid to because of the beeping. i will most likely buy a different model soon. On the other side, I have an older dog, who can barely run. This works great for him, there is no mac speed happening there. So he rarely gets beeped unless he is too close, which is perfect.Read more

brand_story.title: The 2-in-1 System of Wireless Dog Fence + Electric Training Collar

feature_bullets: The product has passed Fcc certification. Using the latest technology, and the receiver will not electric shock the dog after the host is turned off.

The transmitter has two modes: fence and dog training. When the DC 5V power supply is not connected, it is in the fence mode when it is turned on; when it is connected to the DC 5V power supply, the transmitter is turned on after it is turned off, and it is the mode used before turning off after it is turned on.
The fence mode is centered on the transmitter, with 100-2,000 feet, a total of 10 levels can be adjusted.

In the fence mode, the intensity of static electric shock can be adjusted by turning the black knob, clockwise, the intensity of static electric shock will change from small to large; counterclockwise, the intensity of static electric shock will change from large to small.

When the dog goes out of the signal range of the transmitter, the receiver will issue a warning. Warning method: first, vibrate for 3-5 seconds, then static electric shock for 3-5 seconds. If the dog does not return to the safe area after working in a cycle twice, the receiver will keep sounding a warning tone until the dog returns to the safe area.

top_reviews.title: Best of its kind out there! LEARN HOW TO USE IT before you put it on & TRAIN YOUR DOG!
top_reviews.body: Don't just slap this on and expect the dog to learn on their own! Also - if you put it on a fence, the dog will easily learn quickly. If you put it through the yard, it's confusing to dogs and they might just be stressed and not use the full area. Also - DON'T USE 24/7. Instructions say to avoid using more than 12 hours a day. If you never take these off, the dog's neck with get sores and then you'll be out of use until they heal. We know from experience! We don't always take them off at night, but we do try to give them more nights without them than with them on. It gives them a break and I'm sure they don't land on the same exact spot when we put them back on each day. Our dogs come into the garage at night, but are outside dogs. I recommend you consider the same plan if you use a shock collar of any kind. There are a lot of settings. If you don't read about how to use these, you may return them thinking they don't work at all. Learn how to turn them on, how to set the shock intensity, and how to set the boundary space (how far from the wire it alerts/shocks the dog). Depending on your yard size and dog attitude, you'll want to find the right setting for each of those things. I like the flashing green light when it's charged, and flashing red when I need to charge it. The batteries last a long time. We're very happy with our purchase. We have two big dogs (90 & 110 lbs) and these work great at less than ½ the intensity. So PLEASE get these but read the instructions and start at the lowest level... Only moving up if needed. Level 4 makes my 110 pound dog jump up in the air and bark. So please don't assume your stubborn dog needs full intensity (4 is not the highest setting!). All that warning out there - these are great. They are smaller than the older version (we recently upgraded and like these better for size and functions).Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021

top_reviews.title: Game Changer
top_reviews.body: We have an 18 month old Doberman that requires a ton of exercise. While working on his training, preventing him from disappearing into the woods has been a bit of a challenge. We take him to the dog park to blow off steam but that's not always an option. We have been looking into physical fencing of all types but for the amount of free space we'd like to provide him it is cost prohibitive. I began researching the invisible fences and ordered this product. Installation was quite simple. The yard is large and surrounded on 3 sides by woods with entrances to a few paths. We used up the 1000' of provided wiring and I picked up another 500' of the 20 gauge invisible fence wire from the local home improvement store. We looped nearly 1500 feet of wire around the perimeter of the yard. As luck would have it, we had a crack running across the driveway at around the halfway point between the house and the road that we laid the wire in and filled it with driveway repair goop. For the rest of the yard, I used the edger attachment on my weed whacker to cut trenches where needed and buried the wire. Instead of burying all of it, we used landscaping staples to secure the wire under the bushes and brush around the perimeter. I understand that nature should do the rest. Finally, I used a drill to twist the wires that cross through the containment area and ran it into the garage where the transmitter is installed. We set the transmitter to trigger the collar at about 5' away from the wire. The collar is set to the lowest level (2), which my wife and I tried on our arms to see what it felt like - a very minor, uncomfortable tickle. With everything tested out, flags planted and collar charged up it was time to train. We walked the leashed dog around the perimeter a couple of times. Along the way, we would stop at random flags and say "no!", walk him past the flags to trigger the warning beep and say "no!" and once walked close enough to the wire to trigger the static. That's all it took. I thought we'd be following the training guide for a month but it doesn't matter if he's chasing birds, rabbits, balls, the kids or our other dog - he will not go anywhere near any of the flags. It he's leashed and we get close to the flags he stops and lays down. This is a game changer for us and our active boy and we couldn't recommend it more.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
We have an 18 month old Doberman that requires a ton of exercise. While working on his training, preventing him from disappearing into the woods has been a bit of a challenge. We take him to the dog park to blow off steam but that's not always an option. We have been looking into physical fencing of all types but for the amount of free space we'd like to provide him it is cost prohibitive. I began researching the invisible fences and ordered this product.

Installation was quite simple. The yard is large and surrounded on 3 sides by woods with entrances to a few paths. We used up the 1000' of provided wiring and I picked up another 500' of the 20 gauge invisible fence wire from the local home improvement store. We looped nearly 1500 feet of wire around the perimeter of the yard. As luck would have it, we had a crack running across the driveway at around the halfway point between the house and the road that we laid the wire in and filled it with driveway repair goop.

For the rest of the yard, I used the edger attachment on my weed whacker to cut trenches where needed and buried the wire. Instead of burying all of it, we used landscaping staples to secure the wire under the bushes and brush around the perimeter. I understand that nature should do the rest. Finally, I used a drill to twist the wires that cross through the containment area and ran it into the garage where the transmitter is installed. We set the transmitter to trigger the collar at about 5' away from the wire. The collar is set to the lowest level (2), which my wife and I tried on our arms to see what it felt like - a very minor, uncomfortable tickle.

With everything tested out, flags planted and collar charged up it was time to train. We walked the leashed dog around the perimeter a couple of times. Along the way, we would stop at random flags and say "no!", walk him past the flags to trigger the warning beep and say "no!" and once walked close enough to the wire to trigger the static.

That's all it took.

I thought we'd be following the training guide for a month but it doesn't matter if he's chasing birds, rabbits, balls, the kids or our other dog - he will not go anywhere near any of the flags. It he's leashed and we get close to the flags he stops and lays down.

This is a game changer for us and our active boy and we couldn't recommend it more.
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2019

top_reviews.title: Biggest piece of junk. DO NOT BUY!!!
top_reviews.body: This is the absolute biggest piece of junk I have ever wasted my money on. We have a livestock guardian dog that was roaming a little too far so we purchased this to enclose about 5 acres for him to stay close. Over the 7 months I have had it, it has worked for MAYBE 7 days. The wire that came with it is too thin of a gauge so we had to get bigger wire. Then the cheap Chinese clips that hold the wire in place would fail so we had to open it up and solder the wires to the terminals. Now it does not get power from known good power sources. When it did work, the shock was not enough to keep the dog in. He would walk right through. We increased to the highest intensity and shaved his neck all around the contact points to ensure good contact. No luck. Save yourselves the money and get ANYTHING else. What a waste.Read more

top_reviews.title: Dangerous Product
top_reviews.body: This product is unusable. It randomly turns on and shocks our dogs. Each We have went through 3 replacement collars and it still continues to happen. Now i cannot return it due to only having 30 days to return. This product takes a week to dig the trenches and set up so 30 days to test the product is not long enough. I now have a $350 system i cannot use along with 3 $125 collars that do not work. The dogs would be in the living room and get shocked. The other day my husky was standing in the kitchen minding her own business and it started to go off and i could not catch her as she was running away. The collar stayed on for almost a full minute before stopping the shock. This is not safe and the company needs to be held responsible.Read more

top_reviews.title: Pas pour tout les terrains
top_reviews.body: Après avoir enterré 500 pieds de fil et constaté que le collier sonnait constamment, peu importe l'endroit sur le terrain, j'ai lu la dernière partie du livre d'instruction à propos des troubles. C'est à ce moment que j'ai appris que des fils électriques, de téléphones et câbles parallèlement à la façade de mon terrain, en plus d'avoir à l'arrière-cour d'autres fils électriques cela créait des interférences. Mon terrain a une superficie de 150 de longueur (parallèle avec les fils électriques) x et de 100 en profondeur. Donc, le collier n'arrêtait pas de sonner sur presque tout le terrain. Je me demande même si l'auto et le toit de tôle du hangar interféraient également avec le collier.Read more

Get your taxes done right with TurboTax 2021

• Before you file, TurboTax runs thousands of checks to help identify missing deductions or credits

top_reviews.title: Beware, It Locks Up and Will Not Boot
top_reviews.body: Apparently I am not the only one with this defective software. It loaded, it ran, then trying to reboot, it just locks up. Will try a remove and reinstall. Happens with this and the Business version. It appears as if some SW designer just wants to add SW burdens on the tax issue. These folks seem to be getting worse by the year. There may be some upgrade before the tax filing deadline but I am not counting on it. So BEWARE if you try to get this early version. I will update as I waste more time on this rather defective tool. UPDATE 1: I managed to have a Restore Point in W10 as well as back up Registry files. After 6 hours of using the Restore Point process I got the machine back to the day before the fatal install. The problem seems to be, still a guess, that TT 2021 does not like seeing TT 2020 or TT 2019 which I had on the machine. I loaded this on a second machine without TTs from previous years and it worked. Now not everyone has the time and experience to go through this process and TT should never have released such a weak product in my opinion. Will update as we progress. UPDATE 2: Reloaded TT 2021 Personal and it updated smoothly. However I still have TT 2020 and 2019 on the old machine and I am fearful of uninstalling since it clearly impacts the Registry entries. My suggestion is let sleeping dogs lie and one a machine is Restored, it will still pick up the old TT entries but one should most likely just leave them alone. Will update as we progress. Just remember to always back up a Restore Point, yes W10 does it usually, but do your own and also back up the Registry. UPDATE 3: Tried to uninstall the TT systems but it fails so we are stuck with them just sitting useless. Beware again of trying too much since I suspect you will mess up the Registry. TT has been a nightmare and hopefully the recent updates are not terminal as well. However on a separate stand alone system they function normally. UPDATE 4: I made the fatal mistake of updating to 21H2 and trying to remove the old TT. Surprise, another Registry shuffle and BOOM, lost MS Store and all related files even after a Restore Point. Solution, bought a new PC and must then scrub the old one, just 6 months old, back to a new OS load and restore all of it. This will take 20-24 hours at the very least. BEWARE!Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021

top_reviews.title: Form 2210 is all screwed up
top_reviews.body: I was already considering switching to H&R Block Deluxe, which is much less expensive than TurboTax Premier + State, but this year's version will definitely make me switch. Somehow Form 2210 for underpayment of taxes is all screwed up and has me owing a penalty because it has the entries all wrong. It has me paying the second estimated tax installment due 6/15/2021, 61 days late as part of the first installment on 7/15/2021, with a $15 penalty. I paid the first installment by 4/15/2021 and the second installment by 6/15/2021. I just bought H&R Block Deluxe as part of the Amazon Cyber Monday 50% off deal, and it does not make this mistake. H&R Block also doesn't have the stupid product activation scheme used by TurboTax that keeps asking you to re-activate the product every time you attach something to a USB port. Adios TurboTax !Read more

top_reviews.body: License code initially recognized by Intuit's website, but download not available with this license code - per Intuit. Intuit tech support said they have had trouble with some discs / licenses ordered through Amazon, starting around Black Friday. They referred me to Amazon tech support - who says they understand the problem but can do nothing but issue a refund - and I have to send back the disc to get the refund. 2 hours wasted on all of this and I am back to square one. This worked fine for the 2020 tax year. I won't order a new copy from Amazon, at least not for 2021 taxes - because I don't know if this will happen again.Read more

product.description: The #1 personal cyber protection solution, trusted by 5.5 million customers worldwide every day. Acronis True Image is the only personal solution that combines award-winning backups with advanced antimalware capabilities in one affordable, easy-to-manage, integrated solution - ensuring a user's digital life is always protected. Backs up everything, including operating systems, personal settings and configurations, photos, files and folders, and mobile data. top_reviews.title: Not really a "Box Version"
top_reviews.body: Yeah, it came in a box. But 'it' was just an activation key, one has to download, install, create an Acronis account, register, and then use. Minus one star for the wrong description. And minus one star from Acronis for no longer offering this product at all! Note that although this product is directly from Acronis, if you go to Acronis dot com you'll find they want you to "upgrade" to "Acronis Cyber Protect Home Office" - ATI-2021 isn't offered at all. I'm tempted to removed another star because the new product (not this one) is subscription only, and not a cheap one at that. But since I haven't actually installed this 2021 product yet, and will definitely *not* be "upgrading" to the subscription plan, will withhold judgement. I am a registered user of Acronis True Image 2020, 2017, OEM (2015), 2014, 2011 and 2009. This review will be updated if anything more significant is found. Update: No changes in stars and this will be my last Acronis product. Installed this 2021 version and ran without problems on a Dell 2-in1 Win10. I saw no discernible changes from my 2020 copy, hopefully it will work better as the 2020 copy was definitively flaky on some systems, I suspect because of the then new tibx backup format. Although they are pushing their cloud storage and anti-malware features, they are not required. (Acronis: note that if they were required, then this review would drop to one star.)Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2021

top_reviews.title: Beat The Subscription Scam
top_reviews.body: I had an older version (TI 2019) and figured it was time for an update. Since that version had a perpetual license, figured I could just port my old license over to the new version. Or, at least be eligible for a good deal on the new version. Man, was I wrong! Acronis has gone over to an annual subscription scheme that's completely outrageous. For personal or home office use, this amounts to a HUGE cost increase - year after year. And yet, the update really doesn't add any significant improvements. There's the Malware feature, but I've already got multiple Malware apps installed - which are all doing a fine job. There's the cloud storage feature (which I don't need), but it, too, requires an annual subscription. See a pattern here? Don't get me wrong - I'm happy with the backup performance, and all of the core tools included. Just as I was with the previous version. But the 2021 version really doesn't offer much more than the 2019 version - even though it costs A LOT more. Then I found this deal on Amazon. For less than I paid for my 2019 version, I get two more PCs on the license, and bypass all that subscription nonsense. Don't know how long this will last, folks, so get it while you still can. Sorry state of affairs for a company that once offered great software at a decent price. Guess that's just the way customers are treated these days. END RANT.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2021

top_reviews.title: This is the last version you can actually Buy!
top_reviews.body: I was horrified to find out that Acronis will no longer sell perpetual licenses to their products. This is the last version of Acronis True Image that is a perpetual license. All the new products are pushed as a subscription based software with a cloud based backup solution. I travel a lot and unable to use cloud based backup nor have the budget to keep paying for the same software year after year. This product is great and offers on premises backup to external media that is attached to the computer. As of this writing, it also has some protection against randsomware. While a few of the computers were destroyed by ransomware encryption on my network, the Acronis backups remained unaffected, and I was able to restore my affected systems within a few hours. Acronis allows for complete system restores or individual files and folders the same or alternate locations. This is especially useful when the fake tech at home thinks that DLL files are useless and try to free up space by deleting them.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2021

top_reviews.title: Has worked on two of my computers
top_reviews.body: I believe in "suspenders and belt" and use three (or 4) different backup softwares, each writing a system drive image file to another drive on the same computer or to an external USB drive. Usually I run one and then another, so I have two system backups at the same state. Why? Because I have had restore failures in the past and want a good second chance. I used Acronis 10 years ago and for 5 years or so after that, but wandered off to a competitor which I still use, but I moved back to Acronis as my "backup" backup because others I'd tried seemed "goofy" to me. Now if I have something spaz out and I have to restore a back up I believe I have two probable solutions, one Acronis. I don't like the subscription mode however, so preferred this version which should work for me for a couple years before I begin thinking about upgrading.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:

product.description:

From practicing baseball to softball, no other baseball trainer offers such a reliable pitching net and steel frame for the highest dependability and rugged use, day after day.

Now, kids can practice with a baseball pitch return that allows them to independently hone their skills. This all-weather baseball rebounder net offers more effective field training than a pitching machine, while still allowing for consistent practice and improvement. Available in two sizes, 68 x 48 and 68 x 44, this baseball return trainer can easily fit in a backyard, on a patio, or in any open space.

Improve catching skills with a baseball throw net that allows for pitch-back practice. Don’t waste time with an inferior baseball training net that warps or tears. See why the Franklin return trainer offers the best value and highest quality!

top_reviews.title: Will thrill kid ballplayers.  UPDATE at 8 months:  Major defect.
top_reviews.body: Powerful and dynamic pitch-back. Sends back line-drives, ground balls, and pop-ups. Puts my kids' old rinky-dink one to shame. Anchoring to the grass is not usually necessary because of the size and weight. One complaint - the locking-pin mechanism to adjust the angle is very loose and comes undone easily if the pitch-back is moved. Also a bit of a pain to put in because you have to line up all the holes while balancing the frame. All in all, a great product. UPDATE at 8 months: Major defect. The black bungee ties that secure the net to the frame are all wearing out and snapping apart - rendering the pitch-back useless. No tension in the net - no ball comes back. This net was stored in a garage all winter. Just cheap ties. Too bad - great product otherwise.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2018

top_reviews.title: It's fun for me (the adult) and the grandkids
top_reviews.body: I am enjoying the the throw back net. I find it to be a fun and relaxing activity to throw a hard baseball at it and catch the returns. I'm 60-something, so i'm not throwing fastballs and it works fine for me. The grandkids (ages 5 & 9) get a kick out of throwing tennis balls at it and trying to catch the return. The net and frame seem durable enough for our usage and I'm confident it is going to last for many years and I will definitely store it inside during our midwest winters. ASSEMBLY: It's not easy to assemble, I didn't really have any big problems but i am fairly handy. The directions aren't great-- i went by the photo on the box for the placement of the net and bungee cords. Deciding where to place the bungee cords is kind of like a math puzzle of sorts. If you don't enjoy the fun and challenge of assembly you're likely going to find this difficult. ONE PROBLEM: the pins that come with this net are for adjusting the legs to the 5 different positions. They go in ok initially, but i have found that they fall out frequently and searching for them in the lawn is a pain. Soooooooo, I went to the hardware store and bought 1/4" pins that are 2 inches long with a locking wire loop (see attached photo for the 2 that I purchased and one of the original ones that fall out). These replacement pins cost $3.00 each. This of course would be a nice improvement for the manufacturer to make. Overall we really like it and I would recommend for folks with a similar scenario.Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020

top_reviews.title: Seems to be pretty solid overall.
top_reviews.body: I'm writing this after one use, so I have no idea how long it will last, but here are my initial impressions... Assembly was simple. It took maybe 20 minutes from start to finish, and required no tools. When I attached the net, I started with opposite corners, did the other two corners, then the sides, then the top and bottom. Note: the photo on the front of the instructions shows it assembled with only 22 of the 24 bungees that are included. You're going to want to space them out so that there's one more bungee above the hinge on both sides. As far as the action, I threw for about an hour, and it worked like I expected it to. You throw the ball at it, and it bounces back. It's a great workout and stress reliever, and it's cheaper than a gym membership or a good bottle of bourbon. The only negative is the stakes that are supposed to hold it to the ground. They're ridiculously flimsy, and two of them bent the first time I tried to use them. They also work their way out of the ground pretty quickly. I'm going to check a hardware store to find something more sturdy.Read more

The only negative is the stakes that are supposed to hold it to the ground. They're ridiculously flimsy, and two of them bent the first time I tried to use them. They also work their way out of the ground pretty quickly. I'm going to check a hardware store to find something more sturdy.

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2020

top_reviews.title: Perfect For Lacrosse Practice
top_reviews.body: I bought this primarily for practicing lacrosse with my son. I couldn't be any happier with it. The return angles are perfect... everything from pop-flys to ground balls, even without having to adjust the back legs. Lacrosse balls are heavier than baseballs, so I know it'll work great for baseball too. Between the price and performance of this piece of equipment, I'm completely satisfied. Money well spent. Update - After 2 years of use/ownership enough of the bungee straps have broken and I'm back in the market for another one. I'm not deducting any stars from my review, because I have left it outside during the entire 2 years, exposed to every weather condition possible.Read more

top_reviews.title: Great concept, but needs improvement in material
top_reviews.body: Product was purchased for my daughter to practice her throwing and fielding. Great concept, but the exterior woven fibres need to be stronger. They attach to the frame by bungee straps and if a ball hits it the woven fibres seem to break. She hasn’t used it more than a dozen times and I am feeling the rebound betting will have to be purchased and replaced. I would recommend to the manufacturer to up size the exterior perimeter of the netting where the bungees attach. I reordered it and returned the first one. The second one unfortunately is experiencing the same issue with the woven netting. I installed a pool noodle on the bottom of the frame too. The bungees on the bottom of the frame seem to start to fray because they are in direct contact with the groundRead more

top_reviews.title: Helps keep my garage clean and everything together!
top_reviews.body: The media could not be loaded. We are a huge basketball loving family!!!!! We love all sports but basketball Being our main!!! This past summer we reorganized our garage and added a bunch of organization things.... this being one of! Since we have so many balls this was the most ideal thing to buy. Assembly was very easy, about 10 minutes and done. The quality is sturdy, reliable and good! It’s an all metal frame. There is multiple levels to store various size balls not only basketballs... the bottom tier has a mesh rack so you can store smaller size items without it falling through the cracks of the upper racks. It has swivel wheels so my sons and grandsons can roll the whole thing out when they go out to play! This has made my garage look so much neater!!! I have bought a few other organization things that has eased up the congestion in my garage!! If you’re looking into storage and organizing and have a ton of sports like things this would be a good or ideal choice, there are similar ones that hold more or less!! Nothing beats having a well organized garage! Hope this was helpfulRead more

top_reviews.title: Makes it fun to retrieve and return balls from the garage
top_reviews.body: I previously purchased a ball rack for more than half the money and it basically fell apart. This rack was purchased as a replacement. It is amazing and sturdy with a beautiful finish. This rack was easy to assemble and the storage capacity is more than I asked for. This rack not only has the three racks but has a bottom catch all shelf basket. I had bought this for our garage and it fits under a shelf. Now the kids roll this down the driveway for basket and dodge ball fun but it allows the kids to return the balls back on the rack and in the garage within minutes.Read more

top_reviews.title: Solid ball rack, very sturdy, holds balls perfectly, and was very easy to assemble.
top_reviews.body: My girl just has balls all over the garage, where I found this one when hunting for a solution. Out of the box, the bars have a good weight to them, and each piece snaps in solid. The bolts are good sized and holds the frame rock solid after assembly. The racks can be hung anywhere on the ball rack, and the hooks on either side. I just love how the hook hold on to my tennis ball carrier, that is so cool. It came with rollers, where I thought I would leave them off, however, after putting them on, its nice that it can roll out of the way, if needed. The wheels have locks on all four wheel, which is just awesome where most only have it on two of the four. No cons, well made and solid design, where I am very happy with the purchase.Read more
